If A and B are not scalar, they must be of the same size and full_res is a boolean matrix of their common size. The result is the element-wise and operation between A and B.
If A or B is a scalar, full_res is a boolean matrix of the size of the other operand. The result is the element-wise and operation between the matrix of the greater size and the scalar.

The short-circuit operation evaluates to false if any entry of A is false. In this case B is not evaluated.
See and for the definition of the evaluation to false depending on type and encoding.

refsection.title: Описание
refsection.para: When the right and left operands are not both of integer type, A & B yields the element-wise logical AND of matrices A and B evaluated as matrices of boolean. A and B must be matrices with the same dimensions or one from them must be a single boolean. If any operand is sparse the result of A & B is sparse encoded.
When both operands are of integer type, A & B yields the bitwise comparison between each element of A and B.

For if and while control structures or when computing A && B, the left operand is evaluated prior to the right operand. If any entry in the left operand is false, the result is set to %f short-circuiting the evaluation of the right operand. Otherwise, A & B is computed.
